title: A thrill ride
content: This is my first time reading from this author ,I really enjoyed it so much. ! I would highly recommend this book and I’m really looking forward to the second one coming out. Can't wait to read it !
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: This was a good read. I love crime thrillers and had not read a book by Daniel G Miller. I’m now a fan. I read it in less than two days, that’s a record for me. I really like that he talked with an actual missing person investigator, a PI, and learned Korean culture for accuracy when writing the book. This is the first of two books. Cant wait for The Red Letter. I have pre-ordered.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2024

title: Excellent book !!
content: This book really has you thinking.  Is it all connected? Was she manipulated,  kidnapped, or left voluntary?? The whole book has you guessing. Either you know or have no idea what's going on.  It's a steady pace book that builds the story. The last couple of chapters take it there!! That's how you FIGHT OR FLIGHT!! Great and easy read!
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2024

content: Will she perserve through the unknown, danger, and suspicion? Follow the never-ending journey with Hazel Cho.

title: Even paced read, then boom !
content: The Orphanage By The Lake is a book that is hard to put down. Full of intriguing characters that all seem to have some guilt, P.I. Hazel works on a deadline to find a missing girl. It's a great plot with a thrilling end.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: I was immediately taken aback to discover this book was written by a male in the first person POV of a female protagonist. I wondered how a man could possibly express the emotions of the opposite sex, but Daniel Miller did so magnificently. A true page-turner mystery. I will be reading more by this author.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2024

content: I read this book in a few days, it was good, I was not surprised by the ending. I will order the next one in this series.

title: Wow!
content: I was searching for a book to select for our book club and hit the jackpot with this fabulous book!  I wanted a page turner that was suspenseful and entertaining, and this book did not disappoint.  I can’t wait for “The Red Letter” next year.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: I'm an avid reader and when I ordered a set of books a month ago, I was thrilled to start reading them. Not having known much about Mr. Miller, I decided to give this book a try just based on the title as well as the illustration on the cover. Boy, I did not realize how good of a book I would be picking up and reading. The story was an interesting read and kept you turning the page to find out what happens. In this review I'm not going to divulge any details of the actual plot since that's the reason you're buying the book but, in general, it is a very vivid adventure story based upon crime and the compelling narrative to seek out the truth. In general, I highly recommend this book. So much so that I'm writing a review which I usually never leave for products
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2024

title: Good Read
content: Starts off slow, and was unsure if I was going to even finish it. Towards the middle, it picks up and makes you question every person in the book. With the twist I wasn't expecting for it to end the way it did. Can't wait for the next book.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: So, I consume books like potato chips and downloaded this one with minimal expectations. And it is one of the best stories I’ve read in a long time. The main character Hazel is very compelling— she is sympathetic, smart, imperfect, and driven— and the story was riveting. My heart was pounding when the story reached its pinnacle and all I want to do now is read the next book in the series. As a Gen Xer with Gen Z kids, I don’t always relate to Millenial characters but that was not an issue in the case of this heroine and the world the author created for her. Bonus that the book provides compelling yet casual glimpses into Korean American culture.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2024

content: This book kept me intrigued from the start page turner and thrilling. I love have Hazel talked to the reader and had tid bits of little fun jabs that make you laugh.

title: Great Read

title: Verified Purchase
content: I’ve never written a review for a book. Typically, I read them and put them on the shelf when I’m done, but I couldn’t with this. I was hesitant to buy this at first, but I am so glad I did. The character building and plot escalation is timed perfectly imo. When I’d put the book down and went about my day, I found myself unable to stop thinking about what happens next or all the “what ifs.” 10/10 recommend

title: a place of secrets
content: I enjoy a good fast paced mystery and The Orphanage by the Lake was perfect! I originally picked this title for our book club based off of other recommendations but I’m now hooked on the series!
